name: Larch:  Data Analysis for X-ray Spectra
short_description:
Larch is a scientific data processing language that is designed to be easy to use for novices and  complete enough for advanced data processing and analysis. Larch provides a wide range of functionality for dealing with arrays of scientific data, and basic tools to make it easy to use and organize complex data.

Larch has been primarily developed for dealing with x-ray spectroscopic and scattering data, especially the kind of data collected at modern synchrotrons and x-ray sources.  

Larch is written in Python and relies heavily on the standard tools for scientific computing with Python (numpy, scipy, matplotlib, and h5py).
summary: Data Processing and Analysis for X-ray Spectroscopy and More
